Topic: Draw reversible and irreversible changes (ice melting vs. egg cooking)
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture showing a piece of ice before and after it melts, and after it refreezes.
The student can draw a picture showing an egg before and after it is cooked, highlighting that the change cannot be reversed.
The student can draw and label the observations of materials before they are heated or cooled and after the process.
The student can illustrate a change like ice melting that can be reversed, by showing both the melting and refreezing process.
The student can illustrate a change like egg cooking that cannot be reversed, by showing the frying process and its permanent change.
The student can depict and label the cause (heating or cooling) and its effect on the material, showing whether the change can be reversed or not.
